author: rjected
content:
Hi, I've been debugging some reth decoding errors and have been seeing some weird block body (`0x06`) responses. They all have trailing `c0` bytes:
```
06f88080f87dc0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0c0
```
annotated:
```
06 (message id)

f8 (list, length len = 1)
80 (payload length, 0x80 = 128 here)
80 (string, request id, 0x80 = 0 here)
f8 (list, with payload len f8 - f7 = 1)
7d (payload length of list, is 125)
c0 ([], first list item)
c0 ([], second list item)
...
c0 ([], 125th list item)
```
This doesn't look like a valid block body packet to me, but I've been seeing block body responses from multiple clients that contain these trailing `c0` fields. I also tried decoding into geth's `BlockBodiesPacket66`, which fails (I strip the `0x06` byte first). It doesn't seem valid to me. Are there any ideas on why we would be getting these responses from peers?
